definition: to protect/to defend/to guard against/to prevent
to guard/to protect/to defend/abbr. for 衛生|卫生, hygiene/health/abbr. for 衛生間|卫生间, toilet
surname Wei/vassal state during the Zhou Dynasty (1066-221 BC), located in present day Henan and Hebei Provinces

sentences.english: There was no territorial incursion, the ministry said.
sentences.chinese: 没有入侵领土，防卫省说道。

sentences.english: Japan's parliament has passed legislation to upgrade the country's defense agency into a full ministry.
sentences.chinese: 日本国会通过议案，将日本防卫厅升级为省。

sentences.english: Our evident fence near the residence is our confidence of correspondent defence.

sentences.english: As a right of a citizen, seif - defense isn t possessed for the whole life.
sentences.chinese: 正当防卫作为公民的一项权利，并非终生享有的。

sentences.english: Her defenses will wear down after a few weeks in prison.
sentences.chinese: 在监狱呆几星期之后，她的防卫力将会减弱。

sentences.english: You are using Bonetti's defense against me?

sentences.english: The military said he was snatched from outside the base perimeter along with three Afghan nationals.
sentences.chinese: 军方称他是在基地防卫半径之外被三名阿富汗人绑走。

sentences.english: Pick your strongest line-up and prove to me that the defence is in top form.
sentences.chinese: 精选你的强壮排成直线并且跟我证明防卫以顶端形式。

sentences.english: Strengthen defense ties with partner states in the region.
sentences.chinese: 加强与地区伙伴国家的防卫关系。

sentences.english: He briefly served as a senior vice defense minister in 2010.
sentences.chinese: 2010年，他曾短暂担任高级防卫副大臣。

sentences.english: South Korea is not taking any immediate steps to raise its level of defense alert.
sentences.chinese: 韩国军方也没有计划提升防卫戒备。
